text.0: come to our prayers o indra thou who knowest let thy bay steeds be yoked and guided hither.
text.1: though mortal men on every side invoke thee still give thine ear to us o allimpeller.
text.2: thy greatness reacheth to our invocation the sages prayer which potent god thou guardest.
text.3: what time thy hand o mighty holds the thunder awful in strength thou hast become resistless.
text.4: what time thou drewest both worldhalves together like heroes led by thee who call each other.
text.5: for thou wast born for strength and high dominionthen een the active overthrew the sluggish.
text.6: honour us in these present days o indra for hostile men are making expiation.
text.7: our sin that sinless varuṇa discovered the wondrouswise hath long ago forgiven.
text.8: we will address this liberal lord this indra that he may grant us gifts of ample riches.
text.9: best favourer of the singers prayer and praises preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
